statement.p: A triangle has angles of measure \displaystyle{A}={20}^{\circ} and \displaystyle{B}={60}^{\circ}. The side opposite angle \displaystyle{A} has length 4.0. What is the length of the side opposite angle \displaystyle{B}?

solution.p: Because we know angles and a side opposite one of the angles, we can use the law of sines.
